topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d05e726368720443280100#post_54d05e726368720443280100

topics.author: 5446fcfc6368723ec21a0000

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d05e946368727a26a50000#post_54d05e946368727a26a50000
No. Fantastic drama using ballet as a centerpiece to tell it's story. Princess Tutu's story is about the power and wonder of stories. It has it's comedic moments but it never loses site of itself. The characters are all interesting in how they fit and break away from their narrative archetypes. The animation is GORGEOUS and the dancing scenes are just a wonder to behold. It's a full fledged story, that's fun, heart-warming, and even a little sad at times.
